I am heavily surprised on how underrated this is!!! it works wonders in infecting decks (in fact all of them should carry 4), and with [Kavu predator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kavu predator) it's just pure awsomeness!!!!!

posts.post_content: Commander damage aside, it's a nice way to help out an underdog who's getting bullied by a powerful player. When they are being attacked, cast this to give them 3 life and beef up one of their blockers. They will usually thank you for it, and owe you one. Depends on the group you're playing with, I guess, but it's a nice political card for green.

posts.post_content:
@Discoduck  
I would cast this on an opponents creature if it took out a creature that was a threat to me. Its a free for all, you don't want to hurt your position to make your opponents position stronger unless you have to.  
  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
  
This is best used as a combat trick. If you use it to damage the player, your only netting 1 point of damage, unless you put it on a double strike or infect.
posts.html:
@Discoduck
I would cast this on an opponents creature if it took out a creature that was a threat to me. Its a free for all, you don't want to hurt your position to make your opponents position stronger unless you have to.
